citations.narrative:
Enclosures numbered 2, 4, 6, and 8 have protruding wire attached to the upper wooden partitions. Primary enclosures for
guinea pigs must be constructed and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. Licensee must repair,
replace, or remove protruding wire to prevent injury to the guinea pigs. Correct by March 27, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a family member.
n

narrative:
3.28(a)(1) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Enclosures numbered 2, 4, 6, and 8 have protruding wire attached to the upper wooden partitions. Primary enclosures for 
guinea pigs must be constructed and maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. Licensee must repair, 
replace, or remove protruding wire to prevent injury to the guinea pigs. Correct by March 27, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a family member. 
 
 n
